file: RKTL - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 25July2011 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Jul-11.pdf
RKTL - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 30July2012 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jul-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: On the positive side, we did see around £20 million from Project Fuel and we've also started to see price mix  coming through as well in the first half, although Fuel and the price mix were insufficient to compensate  completely for the input costs and adverse mix. Notwithstanding that, it's worth mentioning that Q2 gross margin  was positive and we expect that to continue going forward.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So, what do we see for the second half of the year? We see improving input costs, Q2 gives us a reason to believe.  We actually see further savings coming from Project Fuel, so we targeted £50 million and we believe we're on  track to do that. We also see that price mix will be continue to be -benefit us, so if we have a normal mix of profits  or products or portfolio in the rest of the year, we still see some gross margin expansion for the full year.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Now, as a slight diversion, it's probably worth – we thought we would take the opportunity to show you a little bit  about what Project Fuel is. A number of people have actually said to us, how is it possible that a company like  Reckitt Benckiser that's already so efficient can continue to keep driving sort of cost-saving initiatives up.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So this is a real live example. This is our current – one of our current products. It's a 100-tab canister that we sell  in the U.S. And you can probably see from here that the packaging consists of a metal bottom, a cardboard outer  and a plastic top. If you consider the new pack, it's entirely cardboard. So the difference between that and that in  terms of packaging is big savings. But in addition to that, when you actually put it on a pallet, you get far more  products on a pallet, so you actually get lower transport costs and lower warehousing costs, and the combination  of – and also, frankly, it looks damn sight better. But when you would take a look at that, that gives us about £2  million savings per year.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And there are other things. I haven't got the time, but there are hundreds of examples. But another one is, for  example, would be the Lysol No-Touch Kitchen System in the U.S., where we've moved from four batteries to  three batteries, which actually gives an equally good performance, but that also saves us money. So that gives us  the sort of confidence to believe that we actually have numbers of these things and are on track to deliver the £50  million.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So our challenge here is not to be better than competition. Our challenge is to be in sync with where consumers  are. So that's share of mind. But the last bit is, to my mind, as much as important as the first two, even if it uses  much less money in absolute terms, which is share of heart. And it's all the program that we run around the world  with – from medical marketing, for key opinion leaders, for key dishwash manufacturers, to really promote  healthy cleaning and to sell more machines and to promote better hygiene and promote less water. I don't know  how many of you know that using a dishwasher uses less water and less energy than traditional hand washing –  traditional washing dishes by hand.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So, staying with Health, we have one in Cepacol. Cepacol is, let's say, the Strepsils in the U.S. and we have a range  of [indiscernible] (45:37) products going into the market and the warming, cooling and hydro. And you would say,  well, actually, why do have warming, cooling and hydro? It's very simple. Some people, when they have sore  throat, are looking for a cooling product. Some people need a more warming sensation and some others when they  have sore throat also have they need the feel of hydration.

texts.speaker: Mary Elizabeth Doherty
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Right. Jumping into Home. We have, to my mind, a revolutionary new idea in air. And this has always been a  dilemma in air which is how do you actually capture properly the malodors that exist and give fantastically clean  and fresh fragrances thereafter. So, here we have a product which combines actually, for the very first time, a  carbon activated filter which will capture the malodors and then pass the cleaner air through fragrance, which will  know whether [ph] Richard (51:36) put this also in the goody bag, but this is also a fantastic product. Why? The  fragrance experience, the fragrance quality is absolutely the best we've had in this market. So just to show you  because I might not always be able to do justice to our product innovation, I've got a video, a demo video, to show  you how it truly works.

file: RKTL - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 29July2013 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Jul-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Thirdly, half one saw a slight improvement in net prices realized. Fourthly, we continue to see a more stable  commodity and input cost environment. And lastly, the group benefited from the Project Fuel cost savings  program, which was targeting £50 million per annum and of which a substantial part was delivered during half  two last year.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: For the first time ever, the Power & Free benefit is now available in both a dilutable cleaner as well as a wipe. And  just a reminder, the Power & Free products contain hydrogen peroxide, which kills 99% germs and – 99.9%, in  fact, germs and cleans better without the harshness of a chlorine bleach, so we are very excited about this.

file: RKTL - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 28July2014 345 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Jul-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: I've said often that Europe and North America would have been one region in every  company if they didn't have  an Antarctic ocean to consider. We don't' consider oceans when we decide how to manage organizations. So that's  what we're going to do. As an example, centralized marketing in ENA across brands with one power one market  organization looking after the brand, making it more consistent, making it bigger, making it faster, making it  simpler to operate.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And, lastly, the group continues to benefit from its ongoing core cost reduction program on which Rakesh is  already focused.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: On BEI, you can see the 30 basis points reduction in the level of spend in half one, reflecting a small increase in  absolute spend. The reduction does not, of course, reflect any reduction in our commitment to BEI. Product  innovation and BEI are clearly at the heart of our business. It follows the 60 basis points increase in the level of  BEI spend in 2012 and the 80 basis points increase in 2013, and the important focus on efficiency in BEI signaled  at the start of the year.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: On Finish, we are launching our All-In-One Concentrated Gels. Now, the interesting thing about this product line  is, first of all, it's phosphate-free. Secondly, it works on short cycle. This is a concentrated product. And right now  it's in Italy, and it's going to be taken to 20 more markets in Europe, North America in the next few months.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Now, we are launching an outdoor range with Mortein, and the reason why we are launching outdoor range with  Mortein is because when you have – we know that millions of barbecues are really actually spoiled by insects and  people want to have products, which also work in an outdoor environment. So we are launching a range of  products.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: The one on the left-hand side actually is like a freshmatic product, so it constantly emanates active, which keeps  your insects away. So it's really that same idea, which we have used in air-freshening, also in pest control, so that's  a very interesting way to deliver it, constant – dealing with your pests. It also comes in candles and it also comes  with coil. So we are quite excited about that. It's going into Australia, but also in Brazil and in a number of other  pest control market under the NaturGard platform.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Let's come to Air Wick. On Air Wick, this is our first-ever premium aerosol entry. And the interesting thing about  this Air Wick Pure is that it has a concentrated set of fragrances. So there is no water inside this can. It's not – it  doesn't have a water-based formula. It's a concentrated formula where the amount of fragrance you release is 15  times that of a standard aerosol. So it's a concentrated premium aerosol that we've launched initially in France.  And the early results are indeed quite interesting.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So this is a snapshot of our line of innovations. I've just picked out 15 from a number of them that are going out in  the marketplace, but I want to finish this section on innovation with brand building. And I want to give you one  example on Durex again where we know that there is a significant event which takes place around March every  year. And it's called the Earth Hour.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Earth Hour is a call to action to turn the lights off. So you know when you turn the lights off, Durex has a role to  play, right? And that role is called Turn It On. So, Turn It Off to Turn It On. And we used that idea to make 2  billion impression in 50 plus countries, the consumer engagement was 350 million or so. The video, itself, was  watched by around 80 million, and you will be the 50 or 70 people more watching it now.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Now, I must be candid here, the environment is tougher today than what we saw actually at the beginning of the  year. It has toughened up. I don't know whether you hear the same thing, but we see it tougher. And I think we've  kind of indicated where we see it tougher. But despite that, we believe that we are on track to achieve our top line  revenue results of 4% to 5%.

file: RKTL - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 27July2015 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Jul-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Secondly, we increased our investment and brand equity at 14.4% of revenue in half one. This delivered a $43  million (sic) [£43 million] increase in absolute BEI constant rates, and we also reinvested the material efficiency  savings emerging from our Supercharge initiatives.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: So, we devised an innovative delivery mechanism that gives people the same superior Dettol protection against  germs at the price of a bar soap. Our new hand wash comes with a flip-top squeezy bottle that is proven to kill  hundred illness-causing germs. I wish I could show this to you in person.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: So, moving to Home, and let's focus actually on A ir Wick. Earlier this year, we launched a range of Life Scents air  fresheners. The Life Scents technology offers a unique, multi-dimensional, constantly changing fragrance  experience. In the second half, we are enhancing this range with the launch of a pre mium aerosol range. These  aerosols have been designed to release a finer mist and particle size compared to the market-leading aerosol,  which means a better fragrance dispersion, lesser fallout.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: And to close the innovation section, another innovation from Air Wick. This is Air Wick Wax Melts. This contains  a starter kit that fits the home décor trend that we see in the market, plus wax refills that contain three different  and constantly changing fragrances with the Life Scents technology to give people the  most true-to-life fragrance  experience possible. For consumers, this product offers a safer option to candles. So, this is a snapshot of our  exciting half two innovations and brand roll out that we will believe will help us to deliver our 2015 targets and   beyond.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: And then on operating margins, you will remember I gave you a [ph] heimlich (30:06) target of moderate to n ice  margin expansion. You've seen what we've delivered in the first half, 160 basis points of margin expansion.  Fortunately, there's no English word for this. In the second half, you might remember that we are lapping a very  strong comparative which included a number of non-sustainable cost savings initiatives which we undertook in  the half two of last year, which we estimated at that time to be of the order of 100 basis points.

file: RKTL - Q2 2016 Earnings Call 29July2016 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Jul-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Yes, the input cost environment has been very benign and will not be so benign for much longer. But our focus on  mix, on Project Fuel, on appropriate pricing, and more recently on supply-related Project Supercharge initiatives  has created significant room within our P&L, allowing us to both invest for growth and improving our returns to  shareholders.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: We've got off to a fast start in our investment for growth. Whilst you will see we invested an additional £39 million  behind BEI in the first half, this is actually not telling you the full story, as we continue to achieve and reinvest  Supercharge efficiency savings within our media planning, working media investment, and copy production lines.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: I will come back to you at the end of this presentation to talk about 2016 targets. But before I hand over to Adrian,  I just want to talk about the HS issue in Korea. Whilst we have made great strides as a business over the past 15  years, we have also made mistakes. You will no doubt be aware of one of our Oxy RB products in Korea, which  has caused death and lung injury to people, which I profoundly regret.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Our own efficiency programs continue to be important. We saw benefits both from the ongoing Project Fuel and  also from Project Supercharge. As discussed at prior earnings releases, the early Project Supercharge benefits  were mainly in SG&A spend. And we are now seeing the longer lead time cost of sales benefits being delivered.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Turning then to the next slide. This shows an analysis of operating margin before exceptional items by business  segment for half one. Within ENA we saw continued strong margin progress, 130 basis points increase.  Commodity tailwinds were an important contributor and also our Fuel and Supercharge projects. Pricing in Russia  also contributed.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Following the KCDC announcement, Oxy RB immediately began to withdraw its product from the market. In  November 2012 the KCDC Investigation Committee was formed to review all reported cases of death or injury  from the exposure to HS products and to categorize the cases on the basis of the evidence linking their lung  condition with HS product use. This classification has been undertaken in a series of rounds, the first two of which  are complete. The third and fourth rounds are planned but not yet complete.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: In addition to categorizing cases according to the likelihood of a link between an individual's injury and the use of  an HS product, the KCDC has also made findings based on an environmental survey as to which manufacturer's  HS product was used.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Moving from Hygiene quickly to Home. Let's start with the Air Wick brand, where we've truly upped the innovation  engine over the past 18 months or so. This is Air Wick Pure Essentials. You will recall that we had launched a  range of aerosols with the Pure sub brand. The Pure sub brand, very successfully actually, has done very, very  well in all the markets where we launched that Pure range of aerosols.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: This Pure range addresses really the key aerosol performance gap, which is, when you spray it, the spray really  does not last that long. The fragrance experience does not really last in an aerosol. What is different about this  range is that it comes not just with essential oils, it delivers a superior experience, a fragrance experience that is  formulated so that not a single drop of water is added. And the fragrance is fresher and it's purer and lasts longer.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: Moving from Air Wick Pure Essentials to Vanish. Now as people, we know that dried-in stains are the torture test  for stain removals. If it works on those, it will work on everything. And this is our best Vanish ever, with the  ultimate performance claim of 30-second stain removal, even on a 7-day dried-in stain. And that comes under the  Vanish Gold platform. And we are going to roll it out across Vanish markets.

file: RKTL - Q2 2017 Earnings Call 24July2017 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 24-Jul-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: We continue to invest in the long-term growth and health of our brands. You will see that BEI as a percentage of  net revenue has declined by 40 basis points in the quarter. This principally reflects a reduction in our BEI onshore  as we have cut the non-return-generating investment behind the Wet & Dry Pedi.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: The increased A&P spend was planned and is focused in China and the United States. It was a necessary  correction. The increase in SG&A was in large part the result of reduction in focus on MJN's Fuel for Growth cost  reduction program in the face of the transaction, coupled with the top line reduction.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: But just to remind you all that we have four very interesting size brands in our BMS portfolio. We have, of course,  MegaRed that we've talked about, But we also have Airborne, we have Move Free and we have Digestive  Advantage. And actually, they're all four off a good growth potential, because they all four serve very interesting  benefit platforms. So now, we are introducing – as I just said, just come to our three other innovations, we just  talked about Digestive Advantage, we are introducing Digestive Advantage chocolate bites.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: But anyway, so let's move from Adrian's eating habits to the next innovation, which is about category creation and  a new brand launch. I think we haven't talked about new brand launches and new category creation but I think this  is very exciting. So, I want to talk to you about a category which fits in health and one that addresses a major  unmet need. And all of you who live in London and maybe elsewhere probably think that air pollution is all about  China, but it's not because it's clearly becoming a pressing health issue on a global scale. And it's not just in  China or even New Delhi or India. It's in many other countries and major urban centers including London.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Pollution impacts consumer health as we can understand but also the way we live our lives. For example, fear of  pollution can make parents in China and even other markets reluctant to let their kids play outdoors with obvious  impacts on physical health. This issue of pollution level is also not understood properly because pollution levels  vary greatly. For example, in local areas, let alone within urban centers; for example, indoor air quality is different  than outdoor air quality. It could be two times more pollution inside a tube station versus just outside one. Inside a  room or a car could be a very different level of pollution, air quality versus on outside.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So, the fact of the matter is current outdoor air pollution solutions in the market are generally limited to masks.  And that offers limited flexibility and also addresses the needs of the consumers in a very limited way.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So, what are we doing? We are introducing SiTi, a new brand endorsed by Dettol, a range of products designed  to protect consumers against out of home form pollution. We have developed a new brand for this category, SiTi,  to ensure it's seen as an expert, that it has the credibility. It develops the partnerships to succeed in the long term  in this very important area.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Now, because pollution levels as I explained vary by location, we also need local measurement. And because all  air pollution is not visible, this measurement is a very important element of enabling consumers to monitor their  own personal spaces. So, I think most of us think that air pollution can be seen and you will see this haze and this  black mist around you and that is pollution. But in many times, in a clear day, you might have a very high level of  pollution. And therefore, this measurement of pollution whether it's on a personal space or outdoors requires  monitoring and measurement. And then people can decide what to do with the protection that they need. So, first  in a range of city products is a sensor. Now, this sensor connects you to your [ph] stock (45:40) smartphone, and  constantly monitors air pollution where you are, indoor or outdoor. And if it goes into the yellow or the red zone, it  will send you an alert asking you to take action. So, you've got the first starting point is a monitor whic h is a  connected device with attachment to your personal smartphone.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Now, to protect against this pollution sensing that you will get to know from your monitor, we are launching two  other products. The first one is a mask, but this is no ordinary mask. It is the most sophisticated and high-quality  mask in the market and also contains a micro vent for maximum breathability. Because if you wear mask for a  long period of time, you also worried about whether or not you're inhaling your own carbon dioxide, and  particularly for young children, so what we have provided in this mask is not only the maximum protection from a  PM2.5 point of view, but also breathability through this micro filter, so that you or your children can wear this mask  for long periods.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: The third product in the range are nose filters. You can simply put these inside you. They are very discreet and  you can do that – and takes 98% of the air pollution out. So, it's a very, very effective nose filter. You can – if you  wear one, nobody can see that happening. So, next time you want to run or a morning walk and you think the  pollution outside is high, you just wear it and move forward.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And that's the reason why RB has developed a dishwash tablet specifically designed for the compact desktop  Chinese dishwashers. And therefore, this all-in-one compact tablet is not just a smaller version, if you want, of the  larger tablet. It is a completely different technology. The composition is free of phosphates, is designed for faster  dissolution, contains the right balance of bleach and enzymes and has the right ingredients actually to tackle  China's specific food soil challenges very effectively.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So moving to and as the last example of the day before I get to targets and interesting things like that is on Air  Wick. So, the product is called VIPoo and you'll soon know why. And with the launch of VIPoo, we are effectively  creating a new segment in air care and that's called toilet perfumes. I encourage you to see this extremely  interesting campaign for Air Wick VIPoo on your YouTube if you have time. And the insight and the reason why  it's called VIPoo is this, that even VIPs have to use the toilet. And the idea that others would walk in just after you  and smell something nasty is rather embarrassing. And VIPoo is not just a traditional post-poo spray. It's actually  a pre-poo spray. It contains natural essential oils that traps the nasty smells and releases pleasant aromas.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Just add a few sprays in the bowl before you use the toilet and it will create an essential oil barrier, which traps  embarrassing smells before they hit the air. I hope you got it. So, no one really gets to know what really happened  in the toilet.

file: RKTL - Q2 2018 Earnings Call 27July2018 500 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Jul-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Normally, I would extend a warm welcome to you, but I have to say it's a hot welcome, isn't it? Because I haven't  seen U.K. like this. Let's not complain because you always seem to be complaining about weather and even when  it's great we still want to complain about it.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: We had, following the acquisition of MJN, essentially two infrastructure ecosystems: MJN and RB. The MJN  infrastructure had been inherited from Bristol-Myers Squibb in 2009 and shaped into a very cohesive and tailored  package for that business model in the subsequent eight years.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Moving on to something which has grabbed the headlines already actually, Durex. We're launching Durex Air, a  premium brand in China. As we all know, across markets and categories, premium segments are doing well. This  is our most premium range. It is our thinnest range. And we have launched a new variant, which you can probably  read and it's called Warming. And the idea is to actually provide a warming sensation to maximize the heat of the  moment. I will stick to the script and not say any more.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: On Hygiene Home, the reason I want to talk about Harpic, and actually this is that although it looks like a small  thing, actually, which it is, by the way, it's small. This is a single-serve Harpic, I think, but [ph] India, I think, will get  to work (01:04:35) two serves out of this, in my opinion, but it's supposed to be a single-serve product. It seems  like easy to develop because it's like a sachet; it's not. It contains an acid. So, therefore, the technology involved  in developing a single-serve is not just like a shampoo in a sachet. It's more than that. But we know that there's  something material happening in India and that is what is called Clean India. Those of you who are connected to  this, what I'm just talking about, Swachh Bharat. It's one of the biggest programs of the government. And RB  through Dettol and Harpic has been the number one partner in this program, actually, and we're very proud of the  work we are doing to make sure that we can bring hygiene, and sanitation, and education on diarrhea, and other  things like this, and handwashing.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Moving on to Finish, the reason I talk about this innovation is that we knew always that, in Finish, cleaning your  dishwashers, not dishes only, cleaning your dishwasher is an important thing to do. But actually to clean  dishwashers, until now has meant that you have to unload the dishwasher and use it empty. Because of one  simple reason, the technology of the dishwasher cleaner, which is acidic, actually neutralizes the technology of  the detergent which is alkaline.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And, therefore, you cannot use them together. What does that mean? People get lazy, don't use them that  frequently. And secondly, you need more water and energy actually when you use a dishwasher on empty. This  has been a technology challenge for quite some time; something that we knew of because we actually, of course,  are front-runners in this [ph] area (01:07:43).

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: This is the first product which actually works in an alkaline environment. So that actually, first of all, it provides a  synergistic benefit to cleaner dishes but also has a cleaner dishwashing. So you don't have to use your  dishwasher empty. You can actually put with every dish wash cleaning. Detergent, you can also choose to put a  dishwasher cleaner, so that is very, very interesting here, and that's why I chose to actually point it out.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director & President, RB Health Business Unit, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: On SBP, a brand that we own in Brazil, actually it's the market-leading brand by a distance. This is the best  product in the market in terms of personal insect repellency because it has two interesting things. It, first, lasts for  12 hours so you can actually apply it for 12 hours and, therefore – apply it once and works for 12 hours of  mosquito-free skin because of a new ingredient called picaridin. And the second reason I say so is actually you  can apply it. It's safe for children above 1 years of age. So, I think that is quite interesting about this innovation,  and we are the first to market in SBP also.

file: RKTL - Q4 2011 Earnings Call 8February2012 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-Feb-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So let me talk first talk about Cillit Bang. So Cillit Bang will be the brand to carry this is Europe. And what we are  doing is we have formulated a product, again, not an easy task from a technical point of view, which works as a  complete kitchen system. The kitchen system really here is that not only it cleans your dishes and therefore cuts  through the grease, but the foam also can be used to actually clean the kitchen surfaces and the foam is just the  right amount so that it does not cause streaking. So it's a pretty technically difficult thing to achieve this balance of  amazing grease cutting and right amount of foam, but also having no streaks on your surfaces. So it's a complete  kitchen system. It's a versatile product. It's a concentrated product. So the amount of product in every drop is  much more concentrated than the normal dishwash washing-up liquids that you find around Europe.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Right. This is a very, very interesting idea which we are launching. Now, when we talk to moms, they tell us they  want to actually have perfectly clean – and they tell us they have – they want great cleaning, great stain removal,  but they don't like the idea of harsh chemicals. Now, I'm sure some of you can also agree with that.  But people think there's always going a to be trade-off between tough cleaning and safety, like if I give you  something safe, it could not be as good in terms of cleaning or the other way around. What we've managed to do is  to create a product with hydrogen peroxide as its centerpiece that allows consumers to have the same tough  cleaning that a bleach can give you without the necessary harsh chemicals associated with it. And what happens  here is that hydrogen peroxide when coming into contact breaks down into water and oxygen so it does not leave  any harsh residues.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And people don't use Clearasil – they're worried about using Clearasil more than they need to because they think  it could cause drying. But we also know that if they don't use enough of it, it's not going to work as well. So you've  got to get the right balance. What we've given through this device is just the perfect dose of product which is  required to get to visibly clearer skin. So this a perfect dose product. That's point one.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So, that's really the idea, to combine air and fabric use all under one product, but now with a technology actually  which works for several hours. Actually, it works for 12 hours. So it's a 12-hour microencapsulation technology  and we're launching with this initiative also a number of other interesting initiatives with Air Wick. I don't think  we will have time to take you all through all our innovations, but there are quite a lot of interesting ideas on Air  Wick, which we are taking to the market also at the same time.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And last one, I cannot finish this presentation without talking about Durex because you never let me go. And what  we have is on the left side of the screen is a perfect glide lubricant, let's call it that, but most lubricants are water- based and, therefore, they don't last very long. What we have introduced is the first Durex silicon-based lubricant  which has three times longer lasting effect. It's also much better to use in terms of in feel and so on and so forth.  And I'm sure actual use is much better than words here, so I would just leave it at that.

file: RKTL - Q4 2012 Earnings Call 13February2013 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 13-Feb-13.pdf

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: And the second bit is we are focused on – is that we are creating, we are creating a more sustainable business here  and we need to invest behind the pipeline for this business. I think some time ago we exposed you to some of the  pipeline projects that we had, and I said to you at the time of the Q4 conference call that we will be raising our  investment in clinicals in this business and we will continue to do so also in 2013.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: So, our efforts at making this business sustainable just don't extend to what I call business results. We have  produced a sustainable quality of business results, but our efforts are not just about that. We are doing very well  actually in terms of other aspects of sustainability and our social contribution. And I would say that this is an area  that Reckitt Benckiser in typical fashion has been quite understated in. We are pretty understated when we do  things like this, but I want to tell you here that I do believe that RB have had one of the most ambitious programs  in environmental sustainability, one of the most ambitious.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: 2007 we said we wanted to reduce our carbon footprint per unit dose by 20%, and that was an end-to-end, a  cradle-to-grave impact, which means even including the amount of heat and energy that is deployed in using  dishwashers in homes of consumers, to take ownership of that carbon footprint, too. And we have actually  reduced our carbon footprint during this period of time by 20%. That, to my mind, is one of the most significant  achievements that we have made in the area, or even within our peer group made in the area of environmental  sustainability.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: And then this whole issue of social contribution, and we have increased just last year our social contribution with  our primary partners of Save the Children by 60%. We now touch and help over 300,000 children and families  around the year, around the world. So we do believe that this business is not just about results, it's about  responsibility. And I just thought I'd give you an idea about what we've achieved. But our ambition on social  contribution, on sustainability, does not finish with what I told you at the results. We have a vision to take this  beyond, and we call that under the banner of betterbusiness, betterbusiness. And we will be a better business  because we plan to take and reduce our footprint on carbon by a further one-third, or we plan to focus on water  because we do know water scarcity is going to be a global issue, it is a global issue in many markets already, and  we plan to reduce our water impact also by one-third.  And the third element of our vision on sustainability is the fact that we are an innovation engine. And if we  actually integrate our whole mindset of sustainability through our innovation, we will become a better business.  So we have undertaken to make one-third of our new products come from more sustainable ingredients. So it's  trying to embed in a very practical and important way this whole mindset of sustainability under this banner of  betterbusiness. And that's what we want to be, a better business in all ways. And if we do that, I'm absolutely sure  that we will not just be better for environment or better for society, but also better for shareholders.

texts.speaker: Adrian N. Hennah
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer-Designate, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Turning to the next slide, slide 16, and an analysis of gross margin and brand equity investment. In respect of  gross margin, as mentioned earlier and indeed as Liz signaled in July, the group delivered solid margin expansion  in half two after a decline in half one. This has been driven by a number of factors. Firstly, the group fully achieved  the Project Fuel cost savings program, which was targeting £50 million in total and the largest part in half two.  Secondly, half two saw a more stable commodity and input cost environment. Thirdly, while volume and price mix  both continued to contribute strongly to overall revenue growth, half two did see a slight improvement in the  pricing environment. And lastly, of course, the strong growth in the health category helps gross margin mix and  offsets the slightly negative gross margin effect of the higher growth in emerging markets.

texts.speaker: Rakesh Kapoor
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: So, just to remind you all that there was one strong pillar of this strategy – sorry, maybe going too fast, yeah, one  strong pillar of the strategy which is our continued focus on our 19 Powerbrands but now applied with the lens of  Health and Hygiene and Home.

texts.speaker: Heather Allen
texts.profession: Executive VP-Category Development, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And last, but certainly not least, Scholl. But we do know that consumers really struggle with hard skin, calluses and, as we go into the summer  season, they really start working hard to get rid of that issue. We offer many, many solutions, and we're very proud  to have a Hard Skin & Callus Express Treatment, a one-treatment solution now for consumers with a product that  they can apply, a very nice spatula to help them remove it. A great experience so that they can have a single  treatment for fantastic looking feet.

texts.profession: Executive VP-Category Development, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Let me move on to Hygiene, and let me start with Finish. As you know, Quantum is the flagship of our Finish  brands, and our Quantum business continues to do very, very well for us. texts.profession: Executive VP-Category Development, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Home. Vanish. Vanish is about stain removal. Our consumers love us if we help remove stains. We remove the  stains that detergents can't. texts.profession: Executive VP-Category Development, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Our new Vanish Gel will give improved stain removal performance as well as some new tools for consumers to  pre-treat, soak and add it to the wash, so that they can get the right activity that they need for their stain. texts.profession: Executive VP-Category Development, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: Now, I had a sample here which was taken out of the box. So I'm going to rip this apart. This is Air Wick Filter &  Fresh. I think Rakesh has talked to you about Filter & Fresh before. texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc
texts.text: And just to remind you what we have said last year, we said we were 67% of our business was in Health and  Hygiene. That's what we said. texts.text: Moving on from Dettol to Veet. And Veet basically, we all know that people who use waxes want the ultimate  smoothness, but without the hassle that sometimes people have with waxes.
